description:
In this course, you will learn the Basics of what Agile development is, whether you are a software developer or a project manager in charge of keeping development projects on track in an agile environment. This course offers an overview and history to get a basic understanding of all of the following:

  • The definition of Agile (as it applies to projects and software development)
  • The 4 Value Statements of the Agile Manifesto
  • Identify the 12 Agile Manifesto Principles
  • Compare Agile to Traditional (Waterfall) Development Processes
  • The Agile Approaches - Scrum and XP (Extreme Programming)
  • Description of how Agile and Traditional Methodologies Evolve
  • Explain the Program Du Jour Effect
  • Trade-Offs of Using Agile versus not Using Agile
  • Common Misconceptions of Agile

This course will NOT teach any type of code and is not meant to be technical in nature. Having a basic understanding of the software development life cycle is important.
title: Learn the Agile Methodology
